Cri.M.C No.4 Of 2014 Dated this the 1* day of January, 2014. ORDER Accused No.1i5 in Crime No.1117/2011 of Hosdurg Police Station pending as C.P.No.92/2013 on the file of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Hosdurg is the petitioner. The offences alleged against the petitioner are punishable under Sections 143, 147, 148, 452, 427 r/w 149 IPC. Investigation of the crime is completed and the police filed a final report charge sheeting the accused before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Hosdurg. It is submitted that since the petitioner was in Mumbai in connection with his employment, he was unaware of the proceedings pending against him and hence he was not in a position to appear before the court below. The learned Magistrate issued non-bailable warrant for his non-appearance. According to the petitioner, there is absolutely no_ willful negligence or latches on the part of the petitioner in appearing before the court below. Crl.M.C is filed seeking a direction to the court below to consider the bail application on the date of surrender itself. Pua 2014/KER/45 rine Crl.M.C.No.4 Of 2014 2. The petitioner is willing to surrender before the court below. Now, the petitioner seeks a direction to the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-II, Hosdurg to consider his bail application on the date of surrender itself. Accordingly, the Crl.M.C is disposed of directing the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-II, Hosdurg to consider and pass appropriate orders on the bail application, if any, filed by the petitioner on the date of surrender itself with prior notice to the Assistant Public Prosecutor, in the event of the petitioner surrendering before the court below within a period of fifteen days from today. The warrant issued against the petitioner shall be kept in abeyance till the disposal of the bail application. HARUN-UL-RASHID, Judge. bkn/-
